<pad> They have a similar premise, but they have used rather a lot of tedious logic and hammy acting to embellish their over-exaggerated twisted reality. The people who made this film must have received a coaching in their own backyard. Even the beautiful Celia Imrie (a former Scream queen) made her film debut as an annoying extra. In fact, it should be noted that while her acting was more than adequate, she is no talent and doesn't look like a contestant on any slasher film. When we finally get to watch her actually act, her first time performance just doesn't cut it. Her turn as a femme fatale is excruciating, and the lack of plot and logic coupled with some of the more vulgar action sequences makes the outcome of the movie a let-down. Not even as far as she goes, and that's saying something, considering the film is supposedly about a female serial killer who gets a taste of her own medicine. The cast and crew of the movie are obviously all tight on schedule, but that doesn't help things at all. They even use shots of someone in a garbage disposal bag (we know they're going to say I know but don't let me see it, that's prying), that's not hard to see. What happens in this movie has nothing to do with plot and everything to do with empty camera tricks. It's about the hell you're watching. Inevitably, it's all about the thrills and shocks. It's all about the cowardly men in tattered clothes waiting to die. And while indulging in one of those horror flick pleasures, the gut is churning and your back is killing you. Yet you sit there with a big grin on your face, waiting to go out in the cold. Don't go out, just look away. Sorry.
